title: Drawing, "Camaca Palm, a Group of Trees and Vines on a River Bank, Bird, and a Bunch of Leaves, Rio Magdalena, Colombia", May 1853
markings: Verso:  Stamped in ink, at center and again at lower center:  Lugt 457d
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, at upper left:  palma Camaca / Dead leaves; again, at upper right: May; again, center right:  Reddish orange sandy bank / perpendicular broken with clefts and / magnificently rich with vines, grass plants / etc.  Long vine stems trail down perpendic / ularly; and across bottom margin:  Many of the trees present an exquisite effect where the / light yellowish and yellowish green leaves cap the small / masses of dark foliage / Some resemble the Hemlock / in Spring
description: Horizontal view of top of a camaca palm at upper left, a group of trees and vines on a river bank at center, a crane-like bird at upper right, and a sketch of leaves at bottom center.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Camaca Palm, a Group of Trees and Vines on a River Bank, Bird, and a Bunch of Leaves, Rio Magdalena, Colombia", May 1853.
May 1853. Graphite on gray paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-851.
